description: Comprehensive scenario pack for all hospitality operations

scenarios.SA: A front desk agent notices the lobby filling with guests but hasn't checked arriving group sizes or VIP alerts for the next hour.
scenarios.DM: A guest requests early check-in but their room type isn't ready; an upgrade is available but outside comp authority.
scenarios.COMM: Communicating a room change to housekeeping, bell services, and the guest simultaneously.
scenarios.TW: Coordinating between front desk, housekeeping, and maintenance for a quick room turn.
scenarios.LEAD: Shift supervisor managing a team during unexpected high-volume check-in.
scenarios.HF: Agent on hour 10 of a 12-hour shift during a sold-out weekend.

scenarios.SA: A room attendant notices unusual items in a guest room but doesn't connect it to potential safety concerns.
scenarios.DM: Deciding priority between a VIP arrival room, a complaint redo, and standard departures.
scenarios.COMM: Reporting a maintenance issue discovered during room cleaning through proper channels.
scenarios.TW: Coordinating room assignments between morning and evening housekeeping shifts.
scenarios.LEAD: Supervisor managing team morale when short-staffed during peak occupancy.
scenarios.HF: Physical fatigue effects on attention to detail after cleaning 15+ rooms.

scenarios.SA: A server notices a guest's demeanor change but doesn't recognize signs of intoxication developing.
scenarios.DM: Handling a guest complaint about food quality while the kitchen is slammed.
scenarios.COMM: Communicating allergy information from guest to kitchen with verification.
scenarios.TW: Coordinating section coverage when a server is overwhelmed.
scenarios.LEAD: Floor manager balancing guest experience with staff breaks during rush.
scenarios.HF: Bartender multitasking effects on drink accuracy during peak hours.

scenarios.SA: A cook notices temperature gauge readings but doesn't project impact on food safety hold times.
scenarios.DM: Deciding whether to 86 an item or modify preparation when ingredient quality is borderline.
scenarios.COMM: Calling out orders and modifications clearly during high-volume service.
scenarios.TW: Coordinating timing between stations for a large party's simultaneous delivery.
scenarios.LEAD: Chef managing kitchen team through equipment failure during service.
scenarios.HF: Heat stress and fatigue effects on a line cook during double shift.

scenarios.SA: A dealer notices unusual betting patterns but doesn't connect to potential advantage play.
scenarios.DM: Pit boss deciding whether to back off a suspected card counter vs. continue observation.
scenarios.COMM: Communicating a suspicious activity observation to surveillance without alerting the guest.
scenarios.TW: Coordinating table coverage during dealer breaks without disrupting play.
scenarios.LEAD: Shift manager balancing revenue goals with responsible gaming obligations.
scenarios.HF: Surveillance operator attention degradation after 6 hours of monitor watching.

scenarios.SA: Door staff notices crowd density increasing but doesn't project capacity issues.
scenarios.DM: Deciding whether to refuse entry to an intoxicated VIP with significant spend history.
scenarios.COMM: Communicating an emerging situation to security team via radio in loud environment.
scenarios.TW: Coordinating bottle service delivery between bar, runners, and VIP hosts.
scenarios.LEAD: Manager de-escalating a VIP complaint without undermining door staff authority.
scenarios.HF: Decision-making impairment for staff working 2am-6am shifts regularly.

scenarios.SA: Security officer monitoring cameras notices individual behavior but misses accomplice activity.
scenarios.DM: Deciding response level for a verbal altercation that could escalate.
scenarios.COMM: Providing clear incident description to arriving law enforcement.
scenarios.TW: Coordinating multiple officers for a controlled guest removal.
scenarios.LEAD: Supervisor managing team during active emergency evacuation.
scenarios.HF: Vigilance decrement during overnight security patrols.

scenarios.SA: Technician notices equipment running outside normal parameters but doesn't anticipate failure timeline.
scenarios.DM: Deciding whether to attempt repair vs. call vendor for critical system issue.
scenarios.COMM: Reporting a safety hazard discovered during routine maintenance.
scenarios.TW: Coordinating with housekeeping and front desk for guest room maintenance access.
scenarios.LEAD: Chief engineer prioritizing competing urgent requests from multiple departments.
scenarios.HF: Fatigue effects on a technician responding to overnight emergency calls.

scenarios.SA: HR notices turnover trends in one department but doesn't connect to supervisor behavior patterns.
scenarios.DM: Deciding how to handle an employee complaint that could have legal implications.
scenarios.COMM: Communicating sensitive policy changes to diverse workforce.
scenarios.TW: Coordinating between department managers for cross-training initiative.
scenarios.LEAD: HR director mediating conflict between two department heads.
scenarios.HF: Bias effects on hiring decisions after interviewing multiple candidates.

scenarios.SA: Receiver notices delivery discrepancy but doesn't connect to pattern of vendor issues.
scenarios.DM: Deciding whether to accept partial delivery or reject entire order.
scenarios.COMM: Communicating product shortage to affected departments with alternatives.
scenarios.TW: Coordinating with kitchen, housekeeping, and maintenance on bulk delivery day.
scenarios.LEAD: Purchasing director managing vendor relationship during quality dispute.
scenarios.HF: Verification accuracy when receiving large deliveries under time pressure.

scenarios.SA: Therapist notices client discomfort but doesn't connect to contraindication in intake form.
scenarios.DM: Deciding whether to proceed with treatment when client presents unexpected condition.
scenarios.COMM: Communicating treatment modifications to client clearly and professionally.
scenarios.TW: Coordinating treatment room turnover between therapists.
scenarios.LEAD: Spa manager handling guest complaint about therapist without damaging team trust.
scenarios.HF: Physical strain effects on massage therapist quality after back-to-back sessions.

scenarios.SA: Event coordinator notices timeline slipping but doesn't project impact on subsequent events.
scenarios.DM: Deciding how to handle a client's last-minute change request during setup.
scenarios.COMM: Communicating dietary requirements across kitchen, service, and client.
scenarios.TW: Coordinating room flip between back-to-back events.
scenarios.LEAD: Banquet captain managing temporary staff unfamiliar with property standards.
scenarios.HF: Attention to detail degradation during 16-hour event day.

crossDepartmentScenarios.title: The VIP Arrival
crossDepartmentScenarios.scenario: A high-profile guest arrives unannounced 3 hours early. Requires coordination across departments to deliver exceptional experience.

crossDepartmentScenarios.title: The System Outage
crossDepartmentScenarios.scenario: Property management system goes down during peak check-in. All departments must coordinate manual workarounds.

crossDepartmentScenarios.title: The Medical Emergency
crossDepartmentScenarios.scenario: Guest medical emergency in public area. Requires immediate response, crowd management, and family communication.

crossDepartmentScenarios.title: The Staffing Crisis
crossDepartmentScenarios.scenario: Multiple call-outs on a sold-out night with major event. Cross-department resource sharing required.
